results.title: Sudan: a new vision
results.creator_credit: Nychuat Deng and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A lot of people made sacrifices in an attempt to free South Sudan from civil war. Nychuat and her family now live in Australia but they are deeply connected to Sudan and in honour and respect for those that have made sacrifices, they work tirelessly to support the freedom movement in Sudan. This story explores Nychaut’s relationship with her two countries, Australia and Sudan.

results.title: Leaving Tropeoulhos
results.creator_credit: Anastasia Solomidis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Anastasia and her husband lived in a village in Greece. One day a government official arrived to ask whether they would consider migrating to Australia. They talked about it and decided that they had better take up this opportunity to improve their lives and provide opportunities for their children.

results.title: Changing worlds: my journey
results.brief_description:
Mui Mui’s family fled China to Saigon and with the fall of Saigon they experience persecution and are again forced to flee. The journey from Vietnam to Australia is rough and dangerous with time spent in appalling conditions in a camp in Malaysia. Mui Mui reflects on how she and her family worked hard to adapt to a new country and create a new life.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: From Graz to Glenroy
results.creator_credit: Elfrieda Senycia, Viv Mehes and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: This story explores the journey of migration from Austria to Australia for Elfrida and her husband. As they rebuild life in a new country they deal with triumps and disappointments including the humiliation of never having their qualifications recognised in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elfrieda Senycia, Viv Mehes and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: Recovering hope
results.brief_description:
‘Recovering Hope’ captures the personal stories of women who fled their homeland Vietnam for a new life in Australia. Sinking boats, pirates and transit camps were experiences for many as they made the dangerous journey.
This Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House, marks the 30th anniversary of the first wave of migration.

results.title: The Village green
results.brief_description:
Vietnamese poet Huong Trieu worked with ACMI to produce a visual treatment of her poetry about village life in Vietnam. This was part of a VicHealth funded initiative.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: Grandmother's butterfly
results.brief_description:
Phoung traces her family’s journey to Australia and her sadness of leaving behind her grandmother. This story was created as part of a project that marked the 30th anniversary of the first wave of migration from Vietnam to Australia and was funded by VicHealth.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: Possums of Bonegilla
results.creator_credit: Agnes Karlik and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Agnes talks of her migrant experience including her time spent at Bonegilla. She especially focuses on friendships made during those early years of alienation and loneliness.
